access.billing.popup.body:
You have deleted your Cloudflare Access subscription.


**Your application is still protected by Access with the last policies that you configured. Users are capped at five per month. If you want to continue using Access, you must select a plan using the button below. The first five users are free on the Basic plan.**


If you wish to remove Access, please select the Delete button below. Selecting delete will remove all Access protection to your site and delete your policies and identity provider configuration.
access.billing.popup.refresh: Refresh this page to see changes in Access.
access.billing.popup.title: Confirm Access deletion

access.upsell.audit_user.title: Audit user logins and activity
access.upsell.audit_user.benefit1: Generate logs for logins, requests and policy changes across all internal apps.
access.upsell.audit_user.benefit2: Search and investigate logs within the dashboard.
access.upsell.audit_user.benefit3: Integrate with SIEMs for enterprise visibility.
access.upsell.control_access.title: Control user access to applications
access.upsell.control_access.benefit1: Enforce access to specific applications on a per-user basis with easy-to-create and manage rules.
access.upsell.control_access.benefit2: Build rules about who can reach applications based on your SSO. No network segmentation required.
access.upsell.control_access.benefit3: Easily change access policies from the dashboard or API.
access.upsell.simplify_onboarding.title: Simplify contractor onboarding & offboarding
access.upsell.simplify_onboarding.benefi: Seamlessly integrate all major identity providers or give per-application access with a one time PIN.
Give contractors secure access to applications without onboarding them to your companyu2019s SSO.
access.upsell.subtitle: With Access, you can secure access to internal applications without a VPN.
access.upsell.title: Cloudflare Access

edgeauth.appLauncher.name: Access App Launcher Name
edgeauth.appLauncher.description:
Access App Launch is a portal that end users can visit to connect to applications behind Access with one-click. 

Configure who can use this portal here. Once configured, your portal can be found at https://%{authDomain}
edgeauth.appLauncher.modal.description:
When end users visit the Access App Launch page, they will be prompted to authenticate with your identity provider. Once logged in, the page will display the applications they can reach as tiles. When the user selects a tile, the browser will open the application. 

You can control which users in your team can reach this page with the policy below. The rules saved here define who can reach the Access App Launch page. This policy does not impact or change the permissions for any of the applications behind Access.
edgeauth.appLauncher.title: Access App Launch
edgeauth.appLauncher.help: Learn more about the Access App Launch

edgeauth.identityprovider.saml.idp_entit:
The SAML IdP Entity or the Issuer URI. The field here can vary depending on the provider. You can find this value in your SAML server configuration or the metadata XML provided by your IdP.

For example, AzureAD, ADFS, and some Google configurations will use the SAML application ID. Others may use the callback URL:

`https://%{0}/cdn-cgi/access/callback`

For more information, please check your SAML server documentation.
edgeauth.identityprovider.saml.idp_publi: X509 certificate to verify the signature in the SAML authentication response
edgeauth.identityprovider.saml.sign_requ: Sign the SAML authentication request with access credentials. To verify the signature, use the public key from the access certs endpoint.
edgeauth.identityprovider.saml.email_att: The attribute name for email, in the SAML response. Default value is 'email'.

edgeauth.policies.description:
Control which individuals have access to applications on your domain.

To secure your origin, you must also enable [Cloudflare Tunnel](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/connections/connect-apps/install-and-setup/) or limit connections to your origin to allow only [Cloudflare IPs](https://www.cloudflare.com/ips/) and [verify the JWT](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/identity/users/validating-json/).
edgeauth.policies.title: Access Policies
edgeauth.policy.bypass.helptext: *Bypass policies set a path that Access will not protect. You can configure IP or group-based rules, or set the policy to permit all requests with u201CEveryoneu201D.
edgeauth.policy.bypass.note: Note: Bypassed requests will still use HTTPS if it is turned on in the SSL/TLS dashboard. You can also set a page rule to allow HTTP to the specific destination if needed.
edgeauth.policy.config.addnew.title: + Add new policy
edgeauth.policy.config.empty: No policies configured. Click u201CAdd new policyu201D to start.
No policy rules are configured. Click u201CIncludeu201D to start.

edgeauth.setup.add_first_policy.descript: **Great!** Now that you've set your login domain, let's create your first policy. Access adds a login page in front of the domain you provide in this policy and requires your visitors to authenticate before reaching the content of your site.
edgeauth.setup.beta_ending: Thank you for participating in the Access beta. Weu2019re excited to announce that Access is available to all customers as of July 24th. Please select a plan before August 24th to continue using Access.
edgeauth.setup.description: Welcome to Cloudflare Access! Setting up Access takes 5 minutes. First we'll need to create a login domain and setup an Access policy.
edgeauth.setup.enterprise.description:
Access provides easy, client-less, protected access to internal resources like a staging site, intranet site, JIRA or other internal company tool that you may currently use a VPN for today. With Access, you can hook up your existing identity provider like Okta, GSuite or Azure Active Directory and Cloudflare will use them to make authentication decisions before a visitor will get access to a resource.

You can begin exploring Cloudflare Access with five seats at no cost. To start a trial and discuss enterprise pricing, please contact your Customer Success Manager and Account Executive.
edgeauth.setup.no_beta.title: Welcome!
edgeauth.setup.subscription.buy_more: To purchase more, click Manage Access.
edgeauth.setup.subscription.current_user: Your team has used **%{smart_count} seat** so far this month. Your free Access seats will expire September 1. [Pick a Zero Trust plan](%{teamsDashBillingURL}) before September 1 to stay connected. |||| Your team has used **%{smart_count} seats** so far this month. Your free Access seats will expire September 1. [Pick a Zero Trust plan](%{teamsDashBillingURL}) before September 1 to stay connected.
edgeauth.setup.subscription.free_promo.t: Configuration for Access has moved to the Cloudflare Zero Trust dashboard as of May 25, 2022. This page has been deprecated. All existing functionality, as well as new features, is available in the Zero Trust dashboard.
edgeauth.setup.subscription.free_promo.d: To help remote employees securely access internal tools during the coronavirus emergency, Cloudflare Zero Trust is available at no cost through September 1. To take advantage of this support, select Access Premium below and enter 5 for Active Users (you can add an unlimited number of users after setup). You will need to provide billing information but you will not be charged.
edgeauth.setup.subscription.description: Access protects internal resources by authenticating against identity providers you already use. With Access, you can control which users and groups can reach sensitive materials without a VPN or making code changes to your site.
edgeauth.setup.title: Setup
edgeauth.setup.verify_auth_domain.descri: We created your login page domain for you. This is the domain seen in the URL bar when visitors authenticate to sites you own. Feel free to change the domain to something that fits better.

edgeauth.setup.no_beta.description:
Click the button below to get started with Access. Access is how you can protect access to internal resources, like a staging site, JIRA or an internal company tool. With Access, you can hook up your existing identity provider like Okta, GSuite or Azure Active Directory and Cloudflare will use them to make authentication decisions before a visitor will get access to a resource.

Access is in open beta and free to use currently. We will be charging **$3 per unique user** in GA. (i.e. If 5 people login using Access, you would be charged $15 that month.)

Setting up Access takes 5 minutes. First we'll need to create a login domain and setup an access policy.
edgeauth.setup.no_beta.enterprise.descri:
Access provides easy, client-less, protected access to internal resources like a staging site, intranet site, JIRA or other internal company tool that you may currently use a VPN for today. With Access, you can hook up your existing identity provider like Okta, GSuite or Azure Active Directory and Cloudflare will use them to make authentication decisions before a visitor will get access to a resource.

Click the button below to get started with your Access trial. Cloudflare Access is a paid feature. Your Customer Success Manager and Account Executive will follow up to discuss Cloudflare Access pricing with you. If you have any questions, please contact your Customer Success Manager.
edgeauth.setup.requested_beta.descriptio: Great! Your beta access is pending. We'll send you an email when your beta access is granted.
edgeauth.setup.requested_beta.title: Welcome!
edgeauth.short-lived.title: Short-Lived Certificates
edgeauth.short-lived.description: Access will generate short-lived certificates during an [SSH session](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/identity/users/short-lived-certificates/) and issue them to [*cloudflared*](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/connections/connect-apps/). Your origin can use these to validate requests as an alternative to SSH keys.

**Your account uses Access Legacy Groups.**
You can now use groups from your identity provider. To migrate or if you have questions, please see instructions [here](https://developers.cloudflare.com/access/setting-up-access/access-groups/). Support for Legacy Groups will conclude on December 1st, 2019

access.dashboard_deprecation: Configuration for Access will move to the Cloudflare Zero Trust dashboard on May 15, 2022. At that time, this page will be deprecated. All existing functionality, as well as new features, will be available in the Zero Trust dashboard. You can begin using it with the button below.
